episodeTitle: Deadly Attacks One After Another! Zoro and Sanji Join the Battle!
description: The Straw Hat Pirates launch their assault against the New Fish-Man Pirates in Gyoncorde Plaza. After Luffy's devastating display of Conqueror's Haki, Zoro and Sanji showcase their post-timeskip abilities, demonstrating the results of their two-year training. The remaining New Fish-Man Pirates attempt to retreat but are rallied by Zeo's speech about their continuing strength of 50,000 soldiers.

events.title: Straw Hats Begin Their Assault
events.description: Following Luffy's knockout of 50,000 New Fish-Man Pirates with Conqueror's Haki, the Straw Hat crew launches their full assault. Luffy, Zoro, and Sanji take the lead, with the latter two ready to demonstrate their new post-timeskip abilities.
events.significance: Marks the beginning of the Straw Hats' coordinated attack and sets the stage for showcasing their enhanced strength after the two-year timeskip.

quotes.text: Stay still. We'll defeat all of you soon enough.
quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy's confident declaration to Hody Jones and the remaining Fish-Man Pirates

events.title: Zeo Rallies the Remaining New Fish-Man Pirates
events.description: As the New Fish-Man Pirates begin to retreat in fear after witnessing Luffy knock out 50,000 of their comrades, Zeo steps forward and rallies them. He argues that despite losing 50,000 soldiers, they still have 50,000 remaining, and declares the Straw Hats their worst enemy and Jinbe a traitor.
events.significance: Demonstrates Zeo's role as an officer and strategist of the New Fish-Man Pirates, maintaining morale despite overwhelming odds. Shows the deep-seated hatred the New Fish-Man Pirates harbor for both the Straw Hats and those who ally with humans.

quotes.text: If they run away, they deserve death. Even though we have lost 50,000, we are still 50,000 strong!
quotes.speaker: Zeo
quotes.context: Zeo prevents the New Fish-Man Pirates from retreating and reframes their numbers

events.title: Zoro Unveils Kokujo O Tatsumaki
events.description: Zoro demonstrates his enhanced post-timeskip technique, Kokujo O Tatsumaki (Black Rope Great Dragon Twister). The powerful spinning attack creates a massive dragon-like tornado that slashes through multiple New Fish-Man Pirates with devastating force, far exceeding the power of his pre-timeskip Tatsu Maki technique.
events.significance: First major demonstration of Zoro's enhanced abilities after training with Mihawk for two years. Shows his significant power increase and ability to create large-scale devastating attacks. The technique will later be enhanced with Haki to cut even Kaido's scales.

quotes.text: This whirlwind will not cease until its targets are sent to hell.
quotes.speaker: Zoro
quotes.context: Zoro's declaration as he unleashes the Great Dragon Twister, referencing the Buddhist hell Kalasutra

events.title: Zoro Uses 108 Pound Cannon
events.description: Zoro follows up his Great Dragon Twister with the 108 Pound Cannon technique, sending powerful compressed air slashes through the enemy ranks and further reducing their numbers with ease.
events.significance: Demonstrates the versatility of Zoro's post-timeskip arsenal and his ability to effortlessly handle large numbers of enemies that would have posed a challenge before the timeskip.

events.title: Zoro's Training Flashback with Mihawk
events.description: The episode shows a flashback to Zoro's two-year training period on Kuraigana Island with Dracule Mihawk. The flashback reveals the intense training regimen that led to Zoro's enhanced abilities, demonstrating how he developed his new techniques under the tutelage of the world's greatest swordsman.
events.significance: Provides context for Zoro's dramatic power increase and shows the relationship between master and student. Explains the origin of Zoro's new techniques and enhanced swordsmanship.

events.title: Jean Noueilles and Sea Urchin Armor Spine Squad Debut
events.description: Jean Noueilles, a porcupinefish fish-man and commander of the Sea Urchin Armor Spine Squad, makes his first appearance. He and his squadron, covered in dangerous spikes, attempt to attack Sanji by surrounding him.
events.significance: Introduction of a specialized unit within the New Fish-Man Pirates designed to counter close-combat fighters with their spike-covered bodies.

events.title: Sanji Demonstrates Sky Walk
events.description: Surrounded by the Sea Urchin Armor Spine Squad, Sanji reveals his new ability to walk on air - Sky Walk. He effortlessly leaps into the air and remains airborne, avoiding the spike-covered fish-men below. This technique is similar to the CP9's Moon Walk (Geppo) but developed independently through Sanji's leg strength training.
events.significance: First demonstration of Sanji's Sky Walk ability, which fundamentally changes his fighting style by giving him aerial mobility. This ability was developed during his harsh training on Momoiro Island while constantly running from the Okama who wanted to convert him.

events.title: Sanji Unleashes Poêle à Frire: Spectre
events.description: From his airborne position using Sky Walk, Sanji activates Diable Jambe and performs Poêle à Frire: Spectre (Frying Pan: Specter). He rapidly kicks downward with his flaming leg, striking multiple New Fish-Man Pirates simultaneously and sending them crashing to the ground. The Sea Urchin Armor Spine Squad members collide with each other, their own spikes defeating them.
events.significance: Showcases Sanji's enhanced Diable Jambe techniques and his tactical thinking in combining Sky Walk with aerial attacks. Demonstrates his significantly increased leg strength and kicking power after two years of training.

events.title: Sanji's Training Flashback on Momoiro Island
events.description: The episode reveals an extended flashback of Sanji's traumatic yet productive two-year training period on Momoiro Island (Kamabakka Kingdom). The flashback shows Sanji constantly fleeing from the Okama inhabitants who wanted to convert him into one of them. This constant running built tremendous leg strength, eventually granting him the ability to walk on air. The flashback also features Caroline and is longer than the manga version.
events.significance: Provides humorous yet important context for Sanji's enhanced abilities, particularly Sky Walk. Shows how adversity and constant evasion training led to significant power gains. Also hints at Sanji learning Attack Cuisine from Ivankov after winning his battle.

events.title: New Fish-Man Pirates React to Straw Hats' Power
events.description: The remaining New Fish-Man Pirates express shock and fear at the overwhelming power displayed by Zoro and Sanji. They begin to realize that the Straw Hats they're facing are completely different from the crew they might have heard about two years ago. One outlaw compares Zoro's attack to looking like the Grim Reaper's scythe.
events.significance: Emphasizes the dramatic power gap between the post-timeskip Straw Hats and the Fish-Man Island threats. Reinforces that while the New Fish-Man Pirates are a significant force in Fish-Man Island, they are not prepared for the New World-level strength the Straw Hats now possess.

quotes.text: That looked like the Grim Reaper's scythe!
quotes.speaker: New Fish-Man Pirate
quotes.context: A fish-man pirate's reaction to Zoro's Great Dragon Twister attack

events.title: Other Straw Hats Join the Battle
events.description: Following Zoro and Sanji's impressive displays, the rest of the Straw Hat crew engages the New Fish-Man Pirates. Each crew member begins to demonstrate their own enhanced abilities, working together as a coordinated team to handle the massive enemy force.
events.significance: Sets up for the full crew showcase of post-timeskip abilities. Demonstrates the Straw Hats' teamwork and tactical approach to handling overwhelming numbers.

quotes.text: Stay still. We'll defeat all of you soon enough.
quotes.speaker: Luffy

quotes.text: If they run away, they deserve death. Even though we have lost 50,000, we are still 50,000 strong!
quotes.speaker: Zeo
quotes.context: Zeo rallies the retreating New Fish-Man Pirates

quotes.text: This whirlwind will not cease until its targets are sent to hell.
quotes.speaker: Zoro

quotes.text: That looked like the Grim Reaper's scythe!
quotes.speaker: New Fish-Man Pirate

themes.description: The episode heavily emphasizes the growth of the Straw Hat crew after their two-year separation, particularly Zoro and Sanji's dramatic power increases.
themes.symbolism: The flashbacks to their harsh training conditions contrast with their current effortless handling of enemies, symbolizing how hardship leads to strength.

themes.description: Despite showcasing individual abilities, the episode emphasizes the crew working together with implicit trust in each other's strengths.
themes.symbolism: Each crew member takes on specific roles and enemies without hesitation, showing their coordination.

themes.description: Zeo's speech about the Straw Hats being the worst enemy and Jinbe being a traitor reflects the deep-seated prejudice of the New Fish-Man Pirates.
themes.symbolism: The New Fish-Man Pirates' refusal to retreat despite overwhelming odds represents their irrational hatred overcoming survival instinct.

characterSpotlights.development: Zoro showcases his post-timeskip strength through multiple enhanced techniques, particularly Kokujo O Tatsumaki. His abilities demonstrate the results of training with Mihawk, showing his growth toward becoming the world's greatest swordsman.
keyActions: Uses Kokujo O Tatsumaki to devastate enemy ranks
quotes: This whirlwind will not cease until its targets are sent to hell.

characterSpotlights.development: Sanji reveals his new Sky Walk ability and enhanced Diable Jambe techniques, demonstrating the fruits of his training on Momoiro Island. The episode also shows his tactical intelligence in using the Sea Urchin Squad's spikes against themselves.
keyActions: Demonstrates Sky Walk for the first time
Uses Poêle à Frire: Spectre against Jean Noueilles' squad
Shows enhanced leg strength and aerial combat

characterSpotlights.development: Zeo demonstrates his role as a strategist and officer by rallying the troops when they begin to retreat, reframing their situation to maintain fighting spirit.
keyActions: Prevents mass retreat of New Fish-Man Pirates
Reframes their numbers from a loss to continued strength
Declares Straw Hats as worst enemies and Jinbe as traitor
quotes: If they run away, they deserve death. Even though we have lost 50,000, we are still 50,000 strong!

mangaDifferences.difference: Sanji's flashback to Momoiro Island is longer in the anime and includes the character Caroline, who was not featured as prominently in the manga version.
Extended fight sequences showing more details of Zoro and Sanji's techniques beyond what was shown in the manga.

trivia.fact: Episode 555 aired on July 8, 2012 in Japan with a TV rating of 9.3%, ranking 6th for the week.
Kokujo (Black Rope) in the technique name 'Kokujo O Tatsumaki' refers to Kalasutra, one of the eight levels of hot Naraka (hell) in Buddhism.

sources.title: One Piece: Zoro's Strongest Post-Timeskip Techniques, Explained

trivia.fact: This is the first episode where Jean Noueilles appears. He is a porcupinefish fish-man who commands the Sea Urchin Armor Spine Squad.
Sanji's Sky Walk is similar to CP9's Moon Walk (Geppo) technique but was developed independently through his leg strength training on Momoiro Island.
The episode was broadcast on Toonami on June 5, 2022, exactly 10 years after its Funimation simulcast on July 7, 2012.
